definition: festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]

sentences.english: The store owner always jacks up his prices before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 這家店老闆總在耶誕節前哄擡物價。

sentences.english: Company employees received a 25 Christmas bonus.
sentences.chinese: 公司僱員得到25英鎊的耶誕節贈金。

sentences.english: The boy gorged on turkey on Christmas Day.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩耶誕節那天大喫火雞。

sentences.english: Shops are very overcrowded before Christmas.
sentences.chinese: 商店在耶誕節前非常擁擠。

sentences.english: The multi-cultural theme of Christmas has become a part of school education.
sentences.chinese: 耶誕節所代表的多元文化已成爲學校教育的一部分。

sentences.english: Three christmases ago there was a power cut .
sentences.chinese: 三年前的耶誕節有過一次停電。

definition: to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
Lantern Festival, the final event of the Spring Festival 春節|春节, on 15th of first month of the lunar calendar
Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
